text: Rangers meticulously trained by Miao Ying, responsible for reconnaissance and patrols beyond the Great Bastion. Poisoned arrows and long sabers are their two main weapons against the enemy.

The Great Bastion Rangers are the most agile group selected from the Yeoman Cavalry. They are skilled in surviving in the Chaos Wastes and are responsible for reconnaissance and patrol work in the areas north of the Great Bastion. Almost every one of them has a similar background to Miao Ying, harboring a deep hatred for Chaos and never compromising or retreating in the face of the great enemy.
When the Dragon Emperor's orders reached Miao Ying, they emerged from the Hidden Chambers of Wei-Jin, joining the army and bringing death to the enemy.

The Oathsworn are the elite among the Dragon Horse cavalry. When they accumulate enough merits, they receive an invitation from the Dragon Emperor to enter the Hidden Chambers and comprehend the Way of Yin and Yang. But when they emerge, they swear not to reveal a single word.
When the Iron Pagoda charge on the battlefield, nothing in the world can stop their advance.

The Iron Hail Gunners are heavy cavalry forged by Miao Ying. Compared to the Jade Lancers, they utilize technology from the Kunlan artisans and are equipped with heavy metal armor cast in one piece. This armor features a multi-layered composite of different materials and articulated joint design, making it a product that transcends its time. However, even so, its terrifying weight can only be borne by a few Dragon-blooded steeds. Due to its exceptionally high cost, the Iron Hail Gunners' equipment cannot be used to establish a large-scale standing army. The Iron Hail Gunners on the battlefield cannot even be called cavalry; they are mechanisms driven by the power of warhorses.
Moves like thunder, startling both city and countryside

The heavy cavalry of Grand Cathay is called the Jade Warrior Lancers, and their riders come from various major cities. Large contingents of Jade Warrior Lancers are usually stationed in prosperous cities like Fu Zhou and Wei-Jin, and even the more remote southern and western cities will have at least one such unit. Jade Warrior Lancers are not only adept at fighting in open fields but are also trained to fight in the narrow streets of cities. Whether in narrow alleys, on bridges, or in the tunnels of city walls, they can launch devastating charges. And at the Great Bastion, to resist the Chaos hordes, they wear thicker armor than other Jade Warrior Lancers.
This unit has the harmonious attributes of Yin and Yang.
As Heaven maintains vigor through movement, a gentleman should constantly strive for self-improvement.
As Earth's condition is receptive, a gentleman should hold the outer world with broad virtue.
A formation of spears like a forest, horses roaring like dragons, this formation will tear apart even the strongest enemy lines.
Cavalry charging into enemy ranks with explosive-tipped lances, the powerful explosives will violently destroy the enemy's armor and will.

The Fire-lance Cavalry are all unforgivable criminals who will never receive mercy or pardon. All they can do is charge into the enemy ranks with explosive-laden lances for a chance to live another day.
The Fire-lance Cavalry's charge is an attack that burns both life and future.
They brought endless shame to Grand Cathay in life, but their deaths will bring glory to Cathay!
